name: Arelith - Lvl 30 - Sorcerer Path of the True flame and maybe AA?
author: lorddcee

posts.author: lorddcee
posts.content:
Hi! 

I don't have specific restrictions besides being on arelith, so max lvl 30, and I'd like to use the path of the true flame (http://wiki.arelith.com/Sorcerer#Path_of_the_True_Flame) and I'm wondering if it's a good idea to multiclass of stay 100% sorcerer. 

I want to be useful at a distance, moslty PvE, and good roleplay opportunities.  So I'm thinking of going a bit of Arcane Archer, or anything else. But if being pure sorcerer with this path is enough... I'd stay sorcerer!

I'm open to other suggestions!

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Sigh, another "role-playing" path that is direct nerf to the class as a whole.
Sure, take the path if you want to be an "Archer with Fireballs" nothing wrong with that, but the real Sorcerer has so much more potential...
If you do take the path, however, stay away from Arcane Archer, this will only lessen your spell-penetration and overall power.
Besides, what to do with some arrows when you can non-stop unleash evocation spells?
(Unless they have nerfed spells considerably).

posts.content:

posts.author: Thorsson
posts.content: You would want as much DC as possible and Caster Levels as well I would have thought (Dispels & SR), so any dips would have to be very small (one level of PM maybe?). You'll want lots of Metamagic to increase your spell possibilities, plus ESF and ESP. Probably not a lot of room for difference...

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
What Thorsson said, but scratch the PM as well because Arelith would want you to take (at least) three levels of him.
Epic Spell focus & lots of metamagic feats.
